meanings.definition: A unit of pressure equal to 1,000 bars.
meanings.sent1: The scuba tank can hold up to five kilobars of air pressure.
meanings.sent2: Meteorologists use kilobars to measure the pressure in the atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally ordered a kilobars worth of helium balloons for the party!
meanings.sent4: The weight of the world felt like a thousand kilobars on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the door slamming shut echoed through the room like a kilobars of force.

meanings.sent1: The weather forecast mentioned that the pressure would be in the range of 900 to 950 kilobars.
meanings.sent2: Pilots rely on accurate kilobars readings for safe flying conditions.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to predict the storm by staring intently at the kilobars on the barometer.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was so thick, it felt like a kilobars pressing down on everyone.
meanings.sent5: The anticipation before the announcement was palpable, like a kilobars of pressure building up.
